intro: Pilosella hybrida subsp. hybrida, commonly known as the common hawk's beard, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its yellow flowers typically bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to different environments.
